org.jconfigurations.converters

Interface ConfigurationConverter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CollectionConfigurationConverter<T>, MapConfigurationConverter<K,V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseCollectionConfigurationConverter, BaseMapConfigurationConverter, BigDecimalConfigurationConverter, BigIntegerConfigurationConverter, BooleanConfigurationConverter, DoubleConfigurationConverter, FileConfigurationConverter, FloatConfigurationConverter, HashMapConfigurationConverter, IntegerConfigurationConverter, ListConfigurationConverter, LongConfigurationConverter, NoCollectionConfigurationConverter, NoConfigurationConverter, NoMapConfigurationConverter, SetConfigurationConverter, StringConfigurationConverter, URLConfigurationConverter
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ConfigurationConverter<T>
      ConfigurationConverters are used by configurators to convert a configuration
 value into an instance of type  T.
 Several default implementations for primitives and other common types are already provided.
 Users may opt to implement their own converters and specify those via Configuration.converter().
 The BasicConfigurator requires that implementations must provide 
 an accessible no-arg constructor.
    Author:
    George Aristy
    See Also:
    Configuration.converter(), Configurator, Configuration

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Converts value into an instance of type T.
